title: How to Create a Simple Table in Microsoft Word

steps.title: Open Microsoft Word.
steps.content: Open Microsoft Word. Its icon resembles a blue background with a white "W" on top. If you'd rather edit an existing document, simply double-click the document in question.

steps.title: Click Blank document.
steps.content: Click Blank document . It's in the top-left corner of the templates page. If you're editing an existing document, skip this step.

steps.title: Click the Insert tab.
steps.content: Click the Insert tab. This tab is to the right of the "Home" tab in the top-left corner of the Word window.

steps.title: Click Table.
steps.content: Click Table . It's the grid icon directly beneath the "Insert" tab.

steps.title: Hover the mouse cursor over a square.
steps.content: Hover the mouse cursor over a square. You should see a drop-down menu with a series of squares below the Table button; hovering the cursor over a square will cause the pertaining table to appear in your document. For example, selecting a section four squares down and eight squares right will create a table with eight columns and four rows.

steps.title: Click your preferred square.
steps.content: Click your preferred square. Doing so will create a table with your selected number of rows and columns.

steps.title: Open Word.
steps.content: Open Word. It's a blue app with a blue "W" written on a white folder icon.

steps.title: Tap New.
steps.content: Tap New . You'll see this option at the bottom-left side of the screen. If Word opens to a document, tap the "Back" button in the top-left corner of the screen first. If you'd rather load a pre-existing document, tap Open in the bottom-right corner of the screen and then tap a document's name to open it.

steps.title: Tap Blank Document.
steps.content: Tap Blank Document . It's in the top-left corner of the page. If you're opening an existing document, skip this step.

steps.title: Tap the "..." button.
steps.content: Tap the "..." button. It's in the middle-right section of the screen in the toolbar above the keyboard.

steps.title: Tap Home.
steps.content: Tap Home . You'll see this option on the left side of the toolbar.

steps.title: Tap Insert.
steps.content: Tap Insert . It's below "Home" in the drop-down menu that appears.

steps.title: Tap Table.
steps.content: Tap Table . This option is near the top of the options that are listed at the bottom of the page. Tapping it will insert a three-by-three table into your Word document.

steps.title: Tap ▼.
steps.content: Tap ▼ . It's on the right side of the toolbar. From here, you can format your table in a few different ways: Tap a cell to select it for writing. Tap the leftmost button in the toolbar to add a column to the left of your cursor. Tap the button to the right of the leftmost button to add a row below your cursor.

steps.title: Open Word.
steps.content: Open Word. It's a blue app with a blue "W" written on a white folder icon.

steps.title: Tap Blank document.
steps.content: Tap Blank document . It's at the top of the screen. You can also tap a document's name from the left side of the screen to open it.

steps.title: Tap Insert.
steps.content: Tap Insert . You'll see this tab at the top of the screen, to the right of the "Home" tab.

steps.title: Tap Table.
steps.content: Tap Table . It's directly below the "File" tab in the top-left corner of the screen. A table will appear in your Word document.

steps.title: Tap a cell in the table.
steps.content: Tap a cell in the table. Doing so will place a cursor in your selected cell. From here, you can add columns or rows by tapping the Insert button (below the "Insert" tab) and then tapping one of the following options: Insert Above - Add a row above the row in which your cursor sits. Insert Below - Add a row below the row in which your cursor sits. Insert Left - Add a column to the left of the column in which your cursor sits. Insert Right - Add a column to the right of the column in which your cursor sits.
